result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan Thomas Turk

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Arraignment & Plea & Sentencing Hearing Held on 2/17/22

09:21 AM Defendant Dylan Thomas Turk in court with attorney Fredric B. Anderson.  Defendant Dylan Thomas Turk in custody.   Chad LaLor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Anderson receives information, waives reading. This will be a plea sentencing today. Anderson cites agreement.
Court recounts charges in 21CF386 and possible penalties to Defendant. Defendant pleads guilty. Court questions Defendant on his plea. Defendant understands.  Court informs defendant of rights given up by his plea.  Defendant understands those rights. Court finds defendant understands proceedings and finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily and Court finds defendant is waiving rights voluntarily, freely and knowingly. No objection to factual basis. Court finds defendant guilty and judgment of conviction is entered. Count 1 dismissed
in 22CF38, both counts dismissed but read in. in 21CF532, Count 1 is dismissed but read in. in 21CF386, count 1 is dismissed but read in.
Court imposes 3 and 1/2 years fashioned as 1 and one half years initial confinement,  2 years extended supervision, 37 days credit, 1500 fine plus costs, lifetime revocation, mandatory assessment and safety plan, 36 month IID to begin with license restriction. Conditions of payment of outstanding financial obligations, completion of safety plan. Defendant eligible for substance abuse program but not challenge incarceration program.

11:08 AM Defendant Dylan Thomas Turk in court with attorney Fredric B. Anderson.  Defendant Dylan Thomas Turk in custody.   Chad LaLor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Anderson receives information, waives reading, enters pleas of not guilty. Anderson requests plea and sentencing.  Attorney Anderson indicates Defendant has a preliminary hearing on Wednesday in 22CF38 that he wishes to waive and would like all files to trail together with a the plea and sentencing.  Court recounts charges to Defendant and possible penalties.  Questions defendant in his waiver. Defendant is voluntarily waiving preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowingly, freely and voluntarily made. Court binds defendant over for arrangement.  Arraingment set for Thursday, February 17, 2022
no use or possession of alcohol.

01:29 PM Defendant Dylan Thomas Turk in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Dylan Thomas Turk in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dylan Thomas Turk appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.  Court will set the matter for Preliminary Hearing. States request on bail: $1500 cash bail with conditions of no use or possession of alcohol. State gives prior criminal history in Wisconsin. State would note that the defendant is out on bail for two Douglas County matters for his OWI 5th; as well as he showed up at the Jail intoxicated towards the end of December last year. State then gives criminal history for the State of Minnestoa with bail-jumping charges and F.T.A.'s. State notes that defendant is currently out on $750 cash for 21CF532.  
Atty Hoffman asserts defendant has lived at the current address in the last four years. Defendant does have a wife and two kids who live in the area. Defendant is not currently employed. Defendant is not on probation. Atty asserts that Defendant did appear in all of his appearanes for his case of 21CF386. Defendant has no money he can post. 
Court has some concerns with the allegations and his ability to follow court orders. Court does order $1250 cash bail with conditions of no use or possession of alcohol.
Atty Hoffman asserts defendant does qualify 
Text message reminder slip will be sent to the jail for defendant to sign.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Cash bond set; 2021CF000532; Turk, Dylan Thomas_1359142_6.pdf
Signature bond signed; 2021CF000386; Turk, Dylan Thomas_1311879_7.pdf
